meanings.definition: Assigning a date to a document that is earlier than the actual date.
meanings.sent1: She tried backdating the letter to make it seem like it was sent earlier.
meanings.sent2: The company was caught backdating contracts to show false revenue.
meanings.sent3: Backdating the permission slip won't make your teacher forget about it.
meanings.sent4: His attempt at backdating his diary entries only made his lies more obvious.
meanings.sent5: Backdating the check was his way of trying to cheat the system.

meanings.definition: To make something effective from a date in the past.
meanings.sent1: They decided to backdate the policy change to last month.
meanings.sent2: Backdating the insurance coverage saved them from a financial loss.
meanings.sent3: Backdating the warranty on the broken appliance won't fix it magically.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to backdate the contract made it seem like it was always in effect.
meanings.sent5: Backdating the agreement gave them the advantage they needed.

meanings.definition: The practice of setting the date of a document to an earlier time.
meanings.sent1: The backdating of the contract was discovered during the audit.
meanings.sent2: Backdating is considered unethical in many industries.
meanings.sent3: The detective joked that backdating the evidence wouldn't fool him.
meanings.sent4: In history, backdating documents was a common way to alter the past.
meanings.sent5: The art of backdating requires attention to detail and precision.
